revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2016}} {{Use Canadian English|date=March 2016}} {{Multiple issues|{{BLP sources|date=August 2011}} {{notability|biographies|date=July 2016}} }} {{Infobox person | name = Peter Kelamis | image = Peter Kelamis -1- (34930958622).jpg | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1967|12|11|}} | birth_place = [[Sydney, Australia]] | residence = [[Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada]] | website = {{URL|http://www.peterkelamis.com/}} | occupation = Actor, voice actor, comedian | years_active = 1989–present | spouse = {{marriage|Alannah Stewartt|2004}} }} '''Peter Kelamis''' (born December 11, 1967) is an [[Australian]]-born [[Canadian]] actor, voice actor and comedian.{{cite book|last=Willis|first=John|title=Screen World: 2005 Film Annual|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=UCCkhsztnYgC&pg=PA34|accessdate=17 August 2011|date=2006-04-01|publisher=Hal Leonard Corporation|isbn=978-1-55783-668-7|pages=34–}} He is arguably best known for playing Dr. Adam Brody in ''[[Stargate Universe]]'', [[Goku]] in Ocean's English dubs of the animated series ''[[Dragon Ball Z]]'', and Rolf from ''[[Ed, Edd n Eddy]]''. ==Career== Some of his appearances on TV were in ''[[Eureka (U.S. TV series)|Eureka]], [[The Outer Limits (1995 TV series)|The Outer Limits]], [[Corner Gas]], [[Sliders]], [[Stargate SG-1]], [[Stargate Universe]], [[The Sentinel (TV series)|The Sentinel]]'', ''[[NCIS (TV series)|NCIS]]'' and ''[[The X-Files]]''. Film appearances include; ''[[Happy Gilmore]]'', ''Fear of Flying'', ''[[I'll Be Home for Christmas]]'', ''[[Best in Show (film)|Best in Show]]'', ''The Sport Pages: The Heidi Bowl'', and ''[[Everything's Gone Green (film)|Everything's Gone Green]]''. He also had a recurring role in ''[[Beggars and Choosers (TV series)|Beggars and Choosers]]''. As a voice actor, he replaced [[Ian James Corlett]] as the voice of [[Goku]] in [[Funimation Entertainment|FUNimation]]/[[Saban Entertainment|Saban]]'s short-lived [[Ocean Productions|original dub]] of ''[[Dragon Ball|Dragon Ball Z]]'', and also voiced Goku in [[FUNimation]] and [[Geneon Universal Entertainment|Pioneer]]'s dub of the ''Dragon Ball Z'' movies ''[[Dragon Ball Z: Dead Zone|Dead Zone]]'', ''[[Dragon Ball Z: The World's Strongest|The World's Strongest]]'', and ''[[Dragon Ball Z: The Tree of Might|The Tree of Might]]''. During 2000, Kelamis reprised the role in an unrelated dub produced by [[Ocean Productions|Westwood Media]] and [[AB Groupe]] for the UK. He left in the middle of the [[Cell (Dragon Ball Z)|Cell]] arc to pursue other projects, with [[Kirby Morrow]] voicing Goku for the remainder of the production. He has also famously voiced Rolf in ''[[Ed, Edd n Eddy]]'' as well as [[Whiplash (comics)|Whiplash]] in ''[[Iron Man: Armored Adventures]]''. Kelamis originally auditioned to play the Eds, as well as the other male characters in ''[[Ed, Edd n Eddy]]'' but didn't land either role. Instead he was confronted by [[Danny Antonucci]] to play the character of Rolf. He also voiced Reaper in the video game ''[[Devil Kings]]'' as well as providing the voice of Byrne in the CGI animation, ''[[Dreamkix]]''. ==Filmography== ===Film and television=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title !
